doc.title: Hardwood sellers have managed to implement the first round of price hike with effective sales up \(10 - 20 / t\) to \(510 - 520 / t\) . Our channel checks suggest this was met with limited resistance
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/Pulp Paper Good Hardwood Momentum Key To Watch For Downstream ReactionPulp Paper Good Hardwood Momentum Key To Watch For_2025-08-29

passages.text: Hardwood sellers have managed to implement the first round of price hike with effective sales up \(10 - 20 / t\) to \(510 - 520 / t\) . Our channel checks suggest this was met with limited resistance as seasonally better demand, ongoing hardwood gains vs. softwood, anti- involution discussions in China and Suzano's production cut announcement have helped sentiment. However, the softwood market remains weak (despite global profitability pressure) and China paper prices have been either flat (tissue) to down (graphics and paperboard). The latter is mainly explained by ongoing supply growth and expectation of production resumption by Chemning (who have been down since late 2024 and have recently managed to raise debt to resume operations).

We have been noting that hardwood prices at below \(500 / t\) is not sustainable (due to cash cost support), but have also noted that prices have not stayed low enough and long enough for supply to meaningfully respond and lay the ground for a sustainable pulp price recovery. Suzano have announced a second round of price increase, which is likely to meet larger resistance from buyers unless the paper market manage to recover profitability via price increase (it's proving incrementally more challenging due to oversupply). On the positive side, seasonality is likely to be positive in September and October which should play in favor of pulp sellers. But a more sustainable pulp price momentum is dependent on supply cuts.

Goldman Sachs does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision. For Reg AC certification and other important disclosures, see the Disclosure Appendix, or go to www.gs.com/research/hedge.html. Analysts employed by non- US affiliates are not registered/qualified as research analysts with FINRA in the U.S.
Exhibit 1: Virgin-based paper prices in China (in RMB/t)
Exhibit 2: Recycled-based paper prices in China (in RMB/t)

China FOEX hardwood imported pulp prices increased by \(\) 19/t\(to\) \ \(512 / t\) , while domestic resale prices were flat w/w to the equivalent of \(\) 483- 500/t\(. On the softwood side, imported FOEX were flat at\) \ \(689 / t\) , while domestic resale prices also stayed flat w/w to the equivalent of \(\) 637- 703/t\$
Exhibit 3: Hardwood domestic resale prices vs. Hardwood PIX China price (in USD)
Source: RISI, Goldman Sachs Global Investment Research
Exhibit 4: Softwood domestic resale prices vs. Softwood PIX China price (in USD)
Source: RISI, Goldman Sachs Global Investment Research

Global pulp statistics: July shipments decreased \(7\%\) m/m but increased \(5\%\) y/y. July shipments reached 4.6mt, explained by a \(13\%\) m/m decrease from hardwood but off set by a \(3\%\) m/m increase in softwood. Seller's inventories increased 1 day m/m to 47 days, led by a 1- day increase from hardwood, while flat in softwood.
Exhibit 5: Global pulp shipments (kt)
Exhibit 6: Global pulp sellers' inventories (days of supply)

Fluff pulp prices decreased \(\) 43/t m/m\(in July. According to TTOBMA, fluff prices decreased for the 3rd consecutive month in July and continue to point downwards, as supply levels return to normal, led by BHKP and China domestic fluff. Ence's volume should also impact the market soon, as the company is seeking qualification in the market.
Exhibit 7: China's fluff prices (\\$/t)

Dissolving Wood Pulp (DWP) decreased \(\) 6/t m/m\(in July. DWP prices continued to drop in July, with swing production still at high levels, but looking forward, some sellers are trying to hike prices given the elevated exports from China to nearby countries (related to a change in de - minimis tariffs exemption). On the other hand, supply is expected to increase, with Bracell aiming to swing BHKP production (from September to November) and the RGE group going forward with its new 600ktpa lyocell mill in Shandong, which should startup its first line (150ktpa) by end of this year.
Exhibit 8: China VSF and TTO derived net dissolving pulp prices (\$/t)

China's paper net exports down \(2\%\) m/m but up \(3\%\) y/y in June. China's paper net exports reached 517kt in June, with YTD volumes up \(7\%\) y/y. Exports decreased \(5\%\) m/m, but were partially offset by a \(17\%\) decrease in imports (mainly boxboard).
Exhibit 9: China tissue, graphic paper and paperboard net exports (kt)
Source:China Customs,RISI

China's pulp imports were down \(5\%\) m/m but up \(27\%\) y/y in July. 2025 YTD imports remain up \(9\%\) y/y. Total pulp imports reached 2.0mt in July, led by a decrease in hardwood imports (- \(6\%\) m/m) and softwood imports (- \(5\%\) m/m).
Exhibit 10: China's hardwood and softwood imports (kt)
Source: China Customs

China's woodchip imports increased \(4\%\) m/m but down \(17\%\) y/y in July. On a YTD basis however, China's 2025 imports are down by \(14\%\) y/y, likely on the back of the higher availability of domestic wood and declining imports from Chenming (since the company shut down operations in Nov- 2024).
Exhibit 11: China woodchip imports (kt) and prices (in RMB/t)
Source: China Customs
Europe- European containerboard prices down in August. Kraftliner and Testliner declined \(1\%\) and \(4\%\) m/m respectively in Europe, following a weak demand, high supply and strong imports.
Exhibit 12: Kraftliner vs. Testliner in Europe (EUR/t)

European graphic paper prices flat in August. Coated and Uncoated woodfree prices remained flat during August as prices are seen as so low that sellers are not willing to give discounts to gain market share. In that sense, mills continue to take downtime to reduce supply, and market participants believe more production must be cut. On the positive side, there's an expectation that pulp price increases could eventually lead to a bounce back of paper prices as well.
Exhibit 13: Uncoated Woodfree vs. Coated Woodfree in Europe (in EUR/t)

Europe Printing & Writing demand declined \(7\%\) y/y and \(2\%\) m/m in June. European Printing & Writing demand remains subdued, with YTD numbers declining by \(10\%\) y/y. Current demand levels stand \(45\%\) lower compared to 2019 levels on a YTD basis.
Exhibit 14: Western Europe's Printing & Writing paper demand (kt)
Brazil corrugated box shipments increased \(1\%\) y/y and \(12\%\) m/m in July. YTD shipments at 2.4mt (- 1% y/y).
Exhibit 15: Monthly shipments of corrugated boxes in Brazil (kt) and y/y growth (\%)
According to local news, the governor from Mato Grosso do Sul (MS) expects the pulp mill to begin construction in February of next year, with a total investment of \(\) 4B\(and a 2.8mtpa capacity.
Exhibit 16: LatAm Pulp & Paper coverage comp table

Source: Bloomberg, Goldman Sachs Global Investment Research

We, Marcio Farid, Henrique Marques and Emerson Vieira, hereby certify that all of the views expressed in this report accurately reflect our personal views about the subject company or companies and its or their securities. We also certify that no part of our compensation was, is or will be, directly or indirectly, related to the specific recommendations or views expressed in this report.
Unless otherwise stated, the individuals listed on the cover page of this report are analysts in Goldman Sachs' Global Investment Research division.

The Goldman Sachs Factor Profile provides investment context for a stock by comparing key attributes to the market (i.e. our universe of rated stocks) and its sector peers. The four key attributes depicted are: Growth, Financial Returns, Multiple (e.g. valuation) and Integrated (a composite of Growth, Financial Returns and Multiple). Growth, Financial Returns and Multiple are calculated by using normalized ranks for specific metrics for each stock. The normalized ranks for the metrics are then averaged and converted into percentiles for the relevant attribute. The precise calculation of each metric may vary depending on the fiscal year, industry and region, but the standard approach is as follows:

Growth is based on a stock's forward- looking sales growth, EBITDA growth and EPS growth (for financial stocks, only EPS and sales growth), with a higher percentile indicating a higher growth company. Financial Returns is based on a stock's forward- looking ROE, ROCE and CROCI (for financial stocks, only ROE), with a higher percentile indicating a company with higher financial returns. Multiple is based on a stock's forward- looking P/E, P/B, price/dividend (P/D), EV/EBITDA, EV/FCF and EV/Debt Adjusted Cash Flow (DACF) (for financial stocks, only P/E, P/B and P/D), with a higher percentile indicating a stock trading at a higher multiple. The Integrated percentile is calculated as the average of the Growth percentile, Financial Returns percentile and (100% - Multiple percentile).

Financial Returns and Multiple use the Goldman Sachs analyst forecasts at the fiscal year- end at least three quarters in the future. Growth uses inputs for the fiscal year at least seven quarters in the future compared with the year at least three quarters in the future (on a per- share basis for all metrics).
For a more detailed description of how we calculate the GS Factor Profile, please contact your GS representative.

Across our global coverage, we examine stocks using an M&A framework, considering both qualitative factors and quantitative factors (which may vary across sectors and regions) to incorporate the potential that certain companies could be acquired. We then assign a M&A rank as a means of scoring companies under our rated coverage from 1 to 3, with 1 representing high (30%- 50%) probability of the company becoming an acquisition target, 2 representing medium (15%- 30%) probability and 3 representing low (0%- 15%) probability. For companies ranked 1 or 2, in line with our standard departmental guidelines we incorporate an M&A component into our target price. M&A rank of 3 is considered immaterial and therefore does not factor into our price target, and may or may not be discussed in research.

Quantum is Goldman Sachs' proprietary database providing access to detailed financial statement histories, forecasts and ratios. It can be used for in- depth analysis of a single company, or to make comparisons between companies in different sectors and markets.

Buy (B), Neutral (N), Sell (S) Analysts recommend stocks as Buys or Sells for inclusion on various regional Investment Lists. Being assigned a Buy or Sell on an Investment List is determined by a stock's total return potential relative to its coverage universe. Any stock not assigned as a Buy or a Sell on an Investment List with an active rating (i.e., a stock that is not Rating Suspended, Not Rated, Early- Stage Biotech, Coverage Suspended or Not Covered), is deemed Neutral. Each region manages Regional Conviction Lists, which are selected from Buy rated stocks on the respective region's Investment Lists and represent investment recommendations focused on the size of the total return potential and/or the likelihood of the realization of the return across their respective areas of coverage. The addition or removal of stocks from such Conviction Lists are managed by the Investment Review Committee or other designated committee in each respective region and do not represent a change in the analysts' investment rating for such stocks.

Total return potential represents the upside or downside differential between the current share price and the price target, including all paid or anticipated dividends, expected during the time horizon associated with the price target. Price targets are required for all covered stocks. The total return potential, price target and associated time horizon are stated in each report adding or reiterating an Investment List membership.
Coverage Universe: A list of all stocks in each coverage universe is available by primary analyst, stock and coverage universe at https://www.gs.com/research/hedge.html.

Not Rated (NR). The investment rating, target price and earnings estimates (where relevant) are removed pursuant to Goldman Sachs policy when Goldman Sachs is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or in a strategic transaction involving this company, when there are legal, regulatory or policy constraints due to Goldman Sachs' involvement in a transaction, and in certain other circumstances. Early- Stage Biotech (ES). An investment rating and a target price are not assigned pursuant to Goldman Sachs policy when this company neither has a drug, treatment or medical device that has passed a Phase II clinical trial nor a license to distribute a post- Phase II drug, treatment or medical device. Rating Suspended (RS). Goldman Sachs Research has suspended the investment rating and price target for this stock, because there is not a sufficient fundamental basis for determining an investment rating or target price. The previous investment rating and target price, if any, are no longer in effect for this stock and should not be relied upon. Coverage Suspended (CS). Goldman Sachs has suspended coverage of this company. Not Covered (NC). Goldman Sachs does not cover this company.
